turn.0: ELI5 : what is the “right to repair” movement about?
turn.1: Apple has been indirectly locking people out of repairing by "glueing the back on so tightly, you have to break it to fix it", using specially manufactured screws to make it hard to open it, not providing original parts, or simply not allowing third party repair shops to repair Apple products. If they do decide to repair through a third party repair shop because for example, they have a broken screen, they loose their warranty with Apple.

turn.3: The problem lies in the fact that Apple is very harsh when it comes to warranty, and when it's out of warranty they  charge huge amounts of money for an Apple certified repair out of warranty. Well, two weeks later your camera module stops working and it's under warranty, but oh wait, Apple finds a non original touchid sensor that doesn't originally belong to your phone when it got manufactured so your warranty is void. But your battery is still broken and they won't repair it.
